channel.title: PHP & MySQL error
channel.description:
Ok, I have a form that the user enters a few things into, and on the next page, they are accessed by the $_POST variable. When I try to enter those values into a database, I get an error.
The error comes from a line that tries to enter a variable, that holds a string from the form, into a VARCHAR column in the database. I get this error:
[code]Unknown column 'user-entered information' in 'field list'[/code]
No idea why, the one before that works ( Its of an Int type ), but the third one ( Also a VARCHAR ) doesn't work. I've tried changing the VARCHARs to text, still no luck. Here's the piece of code I'm using to insert the information:
[code]mysql_query("INSERT INTO db (theInt, theVarChar, secondVarChar) VALUES($formVar1, $formVar2, $formVar3) ") or die(mysql_error());[/code]
Thanks in advance,
-Weibs.

item.title: PHP & MySQL error
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Not a problem Weibs

And, yes quotes do help with security in that they will prevent such trivial mysql errors and error dumps. But, in regard to integer values, you really shouldn’t use quotes in most cases imo…its primarily only mysql that allows it and its somewhat nonstandard. I think you only need quotes around integers when setting them, but I’m not sure as its been a while since I’ve done much with the language.

Read full topic

item.title: PHP & MySQL error
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

quotes also help with security

Read full topic

item.title: PHP & MySQL error
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

I was trying to limit the amount of information I gave because its for an authorization script, but BobDole understood my problem ( which btw, the quotes fixed it and it works now, I can’t thank you enough. )

Read full topic

item.title: PHP & MySQL error
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

um that makes no sense

that query doesnt say the tables or anything so how we supposed to help u

also in phpmyadmin (if your using it) u can run a query right in it. do that and see if its the query or what

Read full topic

item.title: PHP & MySQL error
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Thanks for the suggestions.

I’ll try the quote thing, because I’ve already done the other two.

Thanks again.

Read full topic

item.title: PHP & MySQL error
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Well first I would suggest putting single quotes around each of the values.
Second, I would be sure to call $_POST[‘value’] instead of $value (in case you haven’t already)
Third, the only reason that would happen (as this query looks fine) would be because a misspelling of a column name or forgetting to add it altogether…so just check that as well.

If it still doesn’t work, can you post the structure of your table ‘db’?

Read full topic
